item.title: 5 Ways to Handle Forms on Your Static Site
item.description: When I first started exploring the potential of static sites, I was attracted by their speed and simplicity. I knew these benefits came at a cost, however: since static sites canâ€™t run backend code, there are limits to what you can accomplish with a static solution. I no longer see things this way. JAMStack is not about sacrificing features for the sake of a performant, easy to maintain website. Rather, it is about re-evaluating how much of your desired functionality should be delegated to your web frontend.
